alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 5:32PM MST until August 23 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 845 PM MST. * At 531 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bagdad. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 149 and 169. State Route 96 between mile markers 0 and 12. State Route 97 between mile markers 156 and 166. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Burro Creek, Boulder Creek, Wilder Creek, Big Shipp Wash, Little Sycamore Wash, Iron Spring Wash, Salt Creek, Copper Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Butte Creek, Contreras Wash, Quail Spring Wash, South Fork Santa Maria River, Black Canyon Wash, Peoples Canyon, Santa Maria River, Bridle Creek, Little Shipp Wash, Loco Creek, Tank Wash, Placeritas Creek and Mineral Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
